practice_questions.question: When does the 'stable' life of a star begin?
practice_questions.answer: When the outward pressure from the fusion reaction balances the inward force of gravity.

practice_questions.question: Based upon the apparent magnitude scale established by Hipparchus, a Level 1 star is ____ times brighter than a Level 3 star.
What is the name of the graph that relates the absolute magnitude of a star to its temperature-luminosity?
What is the class of stars that regularly changes brightness and is very useful for determining distances in space?
What processes in a massive star lead up to a supernova?
practice_questions.answer: 1. It contracts, builds up heat, goes through many fusion stages to the formation of iron. 2. After iron is produced, energy is no longer released; the star collapses and rebounds into a catastrophic explosion.

practice_questions.question: The apparent magnitude of a star is defined as how bright a star appears as viewed from Earth. What does this depend upon?
practice_questions.answer: It depends on the distance of the star from Earth.

practice_questions.question: What is the method used by astronomers to calculate the brightness of a star which compensates for the different distances from Earth?
What is the property of a main sequence star that determines its brightness, temperature and location on the H-R diagram?
What type of star has the same temperature as a main sequence star but is much brighter?
If the remaining core of a supernova has a mass of at least three solar masses, what might it collapse into being?

career_connections.title: Industrial Control & Advanced Manufacturing
career_connections.description: Skills in data processing, sensor calibration, and computational analysis used in astronomy are directly transferable to technical careers in industrial control, advanced manufacturing, and power generation.

career_connections.title: Technical Diagnostics
career_connections.description: Techniques for analyzing star data mirror those used in diagnostics for HVAC, electrical systems, and non-destructive testing in aviation.

career_connections.title: Job Interview Talking Points
career_connections.description: Analyzing the H-R diagram is like reading technical specifications and troubleshooting complex system graphs. The lesson reinforces logical problem-solving and computational fluency, which are essential for technical roles.
